prop.head.label.name: Chapter
prop.head.headtext: Remedies for Breach of Confidential Business Information

para.paratext: In the case of R. v. Stewart,[1] the Supreme Court of Canada refused to recognize the wrongful appropriation of confidential information as theft within the meaning of s. 322 of the Criminal Code.[2] Lamer J. for the court reasoned that:
Since there is no deprivation [of confidential information], there can be no conversion. The only thing that the victim would be deprived of is the confidentiality of the information.[3]

Thus, there is presently no criminal sanction for the wrongful appropriation of confidential information unless the wrongdoer has appropriated actual physical documents that contain confidential information.
